{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341872,"name":"guy","username":"soroka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T16:09:54.946Z","cooked":"

hello,
I am currently working on applying simulations on my team’s 2024 robot code.
I have already created the swerve simulation IO but because we are using navx for our angle, the robot’s rotation doesn’t update.
I saw a thread similar to this where they showed to use the toTwist2d() method on the kinematics to get the rotation, I have tried that and it didn’t work well.
are there any other ways to simulate the robot angle?

thanks in advance

You guys know what’s going on with toTwist2d?

Within simulation, it’s basically been the default for rotation simulation. I can help you guys if you need to get it working.

You can use kinematics.toChassisSpeeds to get the current velocity, multiply the omega by the loop time (0.02 seconds) and add to a variable.
For example, our IO and GyroSimulation classes.
This is the less common approach, but imo it’s the easiest one, and personally how 5990 does it
